text.text_translated:
Every person has rights.  
These are called human rights.  

Wasfia spent her whole life working for human rights.  
She saw many projects to help people.  
The projects taught women and girls.  
Many of these projects stopped.  
They left the women with nothing.  
The projects stopped.  
She thought Bangladesh must help itself.  

She mixed her two passions.  
One is climbing.  
The other is human rights.  
She wanted people? Actually keep: She wanted people to think better about women in Bangladesh.  

She worked on projects in Tibet and Nepal.  
She began climbing then.  

Bangladesh is a flat country by the sea.  
Most people there have never seen a mountain.  

Her work is successful.  
People in Bangladesh are sitting up and noticing it.  
People around the world notice it too.

Remove the editing note and the repeated sentence. Re-evaluate the simplification of key terms to retain more of the original's specific meaning while remaining at an A2 level.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Human rights are rights for all people.  
Wasfia gave her life to human rights.  
She saw many human rights projects in Bangladesh.  
These projects taught women and girls.  
Often the projects stopped.  
When they stopped, women got nothing.  
Wasfia saw that Bangladesh needed to stand up for itself.  
So she mixed two passions: climbing and human rights.  
She wanted to change thoughts about women.  
She began climbing while working on projects in Tibet and Nepal.  
Bangladesh is a flat country by the sea.  
Most people have never seen a mountain.  
Her project is working.  
People in Bangladesh notice it.  
People around the world also notice it.
